org.kj.pxe.protocol.impl

Class DhcpRequestPacketImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kj.pxe.protocol.impl.DhcpRequestPacketImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DhcpPacket, DhcpRequestPacket

    public class DhcpRequestPacketImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements DhcpRequestPacket
    An object that represents a DHCP Ack packet.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DhcpRequestPacketImpl

        public DhcpRequestPacketImpl()

    • Method Detail

      • buildRequest

        public void buildRequest(DhcpOfferPacket offer)
        Sets the data fields of this DHCP Offer packet so that it responds to the given offer packet. The next server IP address, siaddr, is set to the IP address of the server.
        Specified by:
        buildRequest in interface DhcpRequestPacket
        Parameters:
        offer - the offer packet using which this request packet is built

      • readFromBytes

        public void readFromBytes(byte[] buf)
        Reads the packet data from a byte array. This assumes that the bytes represent the data fields as specified by https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2131.txt.
        Specified by:
        readFromBytes in interface DhcpPacket
        Parameters:
        buf - the byte array to read from
        Throws:
        DhcpParsingException - if the opCode is the wrong value.

      • validateDhcpOptions

        public void validateDhcpOptions(java.util.List<DhcpOption> options)
                         throws DhcpTagNotFoundException
        Checks the DHCP options to check that the message type option (53) and vendor class ID (60) exist. The message type option is checked to make sure that it has length 1 and data field corresponding to DHCP Request. The vendor class ID is checked to make sure it contains "PXEClient:Arch:" and "UNDI".
        Parameters:
        options - the List of options to validate
        Throws:
        DhcpTagNotFoundException - if either the message type or the vendor class ID option are not found

      • validateDhcpMessageTypeOption

        public void validateDhcpMessageTypeOption(DhcpOption option)
                                   throws DhcpOptionDataIncorrectException
        Checks the given option to make sure it has length 1 and its data field is set to the value corresponding to DHCP Request.
        Parameters:
        option - the option to check
        Throws:
        DhcpOptionDataIncorrectException - if either the length or the data field is not the correct value

      • validateDhcpVendorClassIdOption

        public void validateDhcpVendorClassIdOption(DhcpOption option)
                                     throws DhcpOptionDataIncorrectException
        Checks the given option to make sure it contains "PXEClient:Arch:" and "UNDI".
        Parameters:
        option - the option to check
        Throws:
        DhcpOptionDataIncorrectException - if either the length or the data field is not the correct value

      • getMagicCookie

        public byte[] getMagicCookie()
        Returns the magic cookie of this packet. Should be equal to "DHCP" when interpreted as a string.
        Specified by:
        getMagicCookie in interface DhcpPacket
        Returns:
        the magic cookie

      • setMagicCookie

        public void setMagicCookie(byte[] magicCookie)
        Sets the magic cookie value. Should be set to the byte representation of "DHCP".
        Specified by:
        setMagicCookie in interface DhcpPacket
        Parameters:
        magicCookie - the value to set the magic cookie as

      • convertToBytes

        public byte[] convertToBytes()
        Converts packet to byte array. Padding is added if necessary in order to ensure that each field occupies the correct number of bytes.
        Specified by:
        convertToBytes in interface DhcpPacket
        Returns:
        a byte array representing all the data in this DHCP packet
